item.title: Have Australian researchers found the secret to treating sepsis?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Former premier joins community calls for speed reduction at 'dangerous' fatal intersection in Newham
item.description: A community in central Victoria is calling for a 20 kph speed limit reduction at a "terribly dangerous" intersection after four major accidents.

item.title: Voters divided as Barnaby Joyce considers contesting New England for One Nation
item.description: One Nation MP Barnaby Joyce says he might recontest his seat of New England as a candidate for One Nation if the party needs him to.

item.title: Federal authorities target black flights and drug importation in Far North Queensland
item.description: A joint police taskforce has been launched in Far North Queensland to target the importation of illicit drugs, forced labour and sexual servitude.

item.title: Canadian skier Cassie Sharpe's horrific crash in the halfpipe reminds us of Winter Olympics dangers
item.description: As Cassie Sharpe lay motionless on the base of the Livigno halfpipe, the excruciating tension reminded us all that winter Olympians are only ever seconds from disaster.

item.title: Fiji, Palau and Tuvalu set to show world leaders climate change impact ahead of COP31
item.description: Fiji, Palau and Tuvalu look set to host world leaders and climate change ministers in the lead-up to COP31 in a bid to encourage larger countries to accelerate cuts to emissions.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos lose World Club Challenge to Hull KR 30-24
item.description: After pulling off three straight comebacks to win the NRL premiership, the Brisbane Broncos fall just short of another miracle against Hull KR in the World Club Challenge.

item.title: Commercial fishing licence buybacks recommended in latest harmful algal bloom report
item.description: Fishing licence buybacks and long-term restocking plans are some of the recommendations in the latest report into South Australia's harmful algal bloom, which has been labelled as "vanilla" by one scientist turned political candidate.

item.title: Eric Dane, star of Grey's Anatomy and Euphoria, dies aged 53
item.description: The star was best known for his role as Dr Mark Sloan in long-running medical drama Grey's Anatomy, and as the patriarch of the Jacobs family in teen hit Euphoria.

item.title: WA councils could make laws to stop cats roaming under proposed state legislation
item.description: The WA government announces plans to give local councils the power to require cats to be contained to owners' properties, to protect native birds and other wildlife.

item.title: Darwin prisoner Clinton Daylight found, returned to custody two days after being freed from jail by mistake
item.description: A 52-year-old inmate who was mistakenly released from the Darwin Correctional Centre two months before his sentence was due to end, due to an "administration error" by prison staff, has been found following a police search.

item.title: Ellyse Perry's evolution cements greatness as Australian cricket milestone looms
item.description: Cricket superstar Ellyse Perry will become the first woman to play 350 matches for Australia across all formats on Saturday.

item.title: Cockroaches peer out of a communications access hole in Adelaide
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Police receive 'reports of crime' in relation to Pauline Hanson interview
item.description: One Nation senator Pauline Hanson accuses the government of trying to put her "back in jail", after police received reports of a crime in relation to the senator's inflammatory comments about Muslims during a media interview.

item.title: Dolphins defeat New Zealand Warriors in NRL trial, Jackson Ford sin-bin for hip-drop tackle
item.description: The New Zealand Warriors' hopes of having no-nonsense forward Jackson Ford on deck for their season opener are in the hands of the NRL's match review committee after he was sin-binned in a 38-34 trial loss to the Dolphins.

item.title: NSW Waratahs defeat Fijian Drua in Super Rugby Pacific round two, Pete Samu plays after birth of child
item.description: Wallabies veteran Pete Samu has helped the NSW Waratahs to consecutive wins to start the Super Rugby Pacific season, just hours after the birth of his child.

item.title: Should Labor do its own refresh after Angus Taylor's Liberal 'rebrand'?
item.description: In the past few days, in a series of largely ignored milestones overshadowed by news of Angus Taylor's new frontbench, Albanese overtook Scott Morrison and John Curtin to become the 12th-longest serving prime minister.

item.title: The town that turned its back on a rape victim
item.description: A local footy star and his mate are convicted of raping their friend. In the tiny town of Balmoral, where the footy club reigns, the town makes it clear whose story they believe.

item.title: Heaviest outback rain in decades forecast to reach SA, NSW and Victorian farmers
item.description: The driest belt of Australia sees its wettest month in decades, and weather modelling tips the outback rain will reach southern Australia this weekend.

item.title: Why Pacific Islands are rapidly de-flagging Russia's fleet of 'shadow tankers'
item.description: Pacific Islands are rapidly de-flagging vessels on their shipping registries after gaining international attention for their role in Russia's "shadow fleet".

item.title: Scientists recommend succulents to protect buildings from bushfires
item.description: As bushfires become more frequent, scientists say garden beds can be a line of defence.

item.title: Falcon-like drones take to the skies to protect almond and fruit crops
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Peregrine falcon drone could save Australian fruit and almond orchards from hungry birds
item.description: A new falcon drone wards off peckish birds that have been destroying valuable fruit crops.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest shows money talks louder than women's testimony
item.description: Why is an email about the trade trip apparently more compelling than the detailed and painful evidence of a woman?

item.title: Vulnerable flatback turtle numbers stabilise thanks to Mackay community action
item.description: Local conservation groups have worked to protect turtle nesting habitats along the Mackay coast for more than 30 years, bringing generational change for these "ancient mariners".

item.title: Bayern Munich coach Vincent Kompany says José Mourinho made 'huge mistake' attacking Vinícius Júnior's character after alleged racist insult
item.description: Bayern Munich manager Vincent Kompany dissects the racism row involving Real Madrid and Brazil star Viní Jr with a passionate 12-minute speech.

item.title: Why economists hate low unemployment for inflation
item.description: The theory goes that if you have just the right amount of workers on the unemployment scrap heap, you can keep inflation in check. The problem is that no-one knows exactly what the magic unemployment rate is.

item.title: Potential release of carp control virus into waterways delayed until 2028
item.description: Release of a virus to control carp in Australian waterways has been delayed until 2028, a decade after it was initially slated for release.

item.title: How Reuters captured that photo of former Prince Andrew leaving custody
item.description: The image, taken by Reuters photographer Phil Noble, went viral when it was published on Thursday. He says capturing the moment came down to a tip-off and more than a little luck.

item.title: The shamans and designer handbags before Yoon Suk Yeol's insurrection conviction
item.description: Former South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol's sentence for insurrection comes after a tumultuous era of shamanism, Chanel bags and conspiracy theories.

item.title: Viral AI videos raise questions about how we view reality
item.description: For a bit of a laugh, Travis Marshall uses artificial intelligence to create wacky videos about his hometown, but his light-hearted content also raises serious questions about reality in the age of AI.

item.title: NASA boss blasts Boeing and agency over bungled test flight that left astronauts stranded on space station
item.description: A bungled Boeing mission that left two astronauts stranded on the International Space Station for nine months has been criticised by NASA's new boss.

item.title: Drugs with estimated street value of $1.45 million seized in traffic stop
item.description: A traffic stop on the Pacific Highway on the NSW Mid North Coast has led to the seizure of hundreds of thousands of dollars' worth of cocaine and cannabis, police say.

item.title: Farmer builds chapel for Tongan workers, the 'backbone' of her banana farm
item.description: A Queensland banana farmer spent 10 years saving to build a chapel for the Tongan workers who form the backbone of her family’s operation on Cape York Peninsula.

item.title: The US Supreme Court's take-down of Trump's tariffs explained
item.description: The ruling on tariffs is a hugely consequential decision that has infuriated the president, who is now looking for workarounds.

item.title: Punch the baby macaque draws a crowd at Japan's Ichikawa City Zoo
item.description: The six month old macaque's relationship with a soft toy orangutan has become an internet sensation.

item.title: Auckland FC defeat Wellington Phoenix 5-0 in A-League Men, goalkeeper Josh Oluwayemi own goal begins rout
item.description: Wellington Phoenix goalkeeper Josh Oluwayemi commits one of the worst howlers this A-League Men season, heading a clearance kick into his own net as Auckland FC romps to a big win.

item.title: South Australian election countdown officially begins, campaign kicks off
item.description: Election campaigning in South Australia is officially underway, with candidates seizing the opportunity to begin making their formal pitches to voters before they head to the ballot box in March.

item.title: Hungary and Slovakia threaten Ukraine over stalled Russian oil shipments
item.description: Hungary and Slovakia, which have both received a temporary exemption from an EU policy prohibiting imports of Russian oil, have accused Ukraine of deliberately holding up supplies.

item.title: Albanese government bears inflation pressure while premiers spend big, poll well
item.description: High-spending premiers remain popular and seemingly impervious to the rising cost-of-living anxiety piling pressure on the Albanese government.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Think you're a trivia boss? Show us what you've got
item.description: Well, this is cute — you thinking you're a quiz pro. It's time to play … HARD!

item.title: On the front lines of Australia's fight against vaccine hesitancy
item.description: With immunisation rates declining and outbreaks of infectious diseases like measles increasing, the consequences of vaccine hesitancy in Australia are becoming clearer.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was the Queen's rumoured favourite. Did she do too much to protect him?
item.description: It will be up to King Charles to shepherd his family's institution through its darkest hour. But could his own mother have done more to snuff out this crisis before he inherited it?

item.title: A visual guide to the prices that landed Coles in court
item.description: The pricing patterns of these six products show how Coles stands accused of using its Down Down marketing campaign to dupe shoppers.

item.title: Coastal communities weigh costs and potential retreat as erosion batters SA's Limestone Coast
item.description: With costs and damage mounting, councils are considering all options, including pulling back from the beaches.

item.title: SA Labor mulls One Nation's rise as Liberals fight for campaign oxygen
item.description: In the final week before the election writs were issued, the SA Premier trained his sights on One Nation while the Liberals fought for oxygen. Is it a sign of the campaign ahead?

item.title: Patients three times more likely to escape from Cumberland Hospital, data shows
item.description: Cumberland Hospital is under investigation after two patients who escaped from its care within 24 hours allegedly caused three people's deaths.

item.title: Daly Cherry-Evans and Sam Walker show promising signs as Eels down Roosters in NRL trial
item.description: Daly Cherry-Evans shows immediate signs of a strong combination with new Roosters halves mate Sam Walker in his first match for his new NRL club.

item.title: Cawleys Bridge retrofit reconnects wildlife habitat above Princes Motorway
item.description: A forgotten bridge over one of the busiest commuter routes in NSW is being reborn as a safe crossing for wildlife.

item.title: Massive goat trap in remote WA merges new technology and old ideas
item.description: When their station's fragile landscape needed protection from feral goats, Calum and Belinda Carruth seized on an idea that has become marvel of technology and pest management.

item.title: Punk's boom began 50 years ago in Brisbane — and the scene is still thriving
item.description: The Saints released their single "(I'm) Stranded" in 1976, kicking off the punk movement in Australia. So how did it all unfold?

item.title: Miner MMG puts forward alternative Rosebery tailings dam site in Exe Valley
item.description: Global mining company MMG has long been seeking to build a third tailings storage dam at its mine on the Tasmanian west coast, in the face of strong opposition from environmentalists. It's now put forward an alternative which conservationists say they won't fight.

item.title: What is the bare minimum when it comes to packing kids' lunch boxes?
item.description: This is the bare minimum you should aim for to cover the nutritional basics for your children's school lunches.

item.title: Eating disorder clinic to open near Mandurah as frustration grows over residential facility
item.description: As an eating disorder clinic prepares to open its doors near Mandurah south of Perth, a residential eating disorder clinic is still in the planning stages despite being on the cards for years.

item.title: Minister reveals process has started to ban Hizb ut-Tahrir under new hate laws
item.description: Tony Burke has also provided an update on the cohort of 34 Australians seeking to leave a Syrian refugee camp.

item.title: After a rare Supreme Court loss for Trump, here's his record with the bench
item.description: Donald Trump was furious when the US Supreme Court ruled that his use of tariffs was illegal. Here's how earlier cases in that jurisdiction have fared.

item.title: Migraine is more than just a headache. A neurologist explains the four stages
item.description: Knowing the four distinct phases of a migraine can help you recognise the symptoms and manage pain at each stage.

item.title: Hundreds of 'toxic' poppies stolen from Victorian farm triggers health department alert
item.description: About 1,700 poppy plants grown for the pharmaceutical industry have been stolen from a regional property north-west of Melbourne, prompting a warning from the state health department.

item.title: Police search for mental health patient on approved leave who did not return to Cumberland Hospital
item.description: Madan Pandey failed to return to Cumberland Hospital after his approved leave ended on February 21.

item.title: Nathan Cleary to risk missing first three Panthers games by challenging ban at NRL judiciary
item.description: Nathan Cleary will either be available to play Brisbane in round one or will miss the opening three rounds after Penrith decided to challenge his high tackle ban.

item.title: Coalition calls to criminalise assistance to ISIS-linked Australians seeking to return
item.description: The federal opposition proposes a new criminal offence to punish those who help Australians with links to Islamic State to return home, accusing the government of being complacent about the possible return of 34 wives and children of former fighters.

item.title: Micro-interventions to reduce stress in your day
item.description: Experts say we don't need to overhaul our lives to reduce our stress effectively. Here are some tips you can use right now.

item.title: 'Fearless, full of passion': Winter Games end with stunning ceremony
item.description: The Milano Cortina Games are farewelled in style as the closing ceremony brings the 2026 Winter Olympics to an end.

item.title: Simon Gordon's endometriosis surgeries were gynaecology's open secret. Now colleagues and patients are speaking out
item.description: Complaints had been made about this gynaecologist for years. Only when hospital management discovered that Four Corners was looking into his practice, did it start investigating further.

item.title: Albanese changes tune on immigration and 'ISIS brides' as One Nation effect hits
item.description: A lot has been written about One Nation cannibalising the Coalition's vote, but less attention has been given to how the rise of the once-fringe party is also activating Labor.

item.title: Reducing inequality means taxing capital more — including inheritances
item.description: Intergenerational inequality will only be dealt with by taxing the people that have the money, not by cutting the taxes of those who don't have it.

item.title: Home owners struggle as insurance premiums rise more than 50 per cent in five years
item.description: Home insurance premiums continue to rise, with properties in natural disaster-prone areas paying the most.

item.title: Three-year wait for national criminal history checker makes parents 'sick'
item.description: A key government commitment to protect children from sexual predators will not be "fully functional" for at least three years.

item.title: Marshall Islands launches first universal basic income scheme to stop outward migration
item.description: Citizens of the Marshall Islands will receive "free money" as the government launches a world-first universal basic income scheme.

item.title: Four years after an election defining promise, practitioners say the SA health system is still struggling
item.description: It was the key promise of the 2022 SA Labor campaign: fix the ramping crisis. But four years on, the state's health system continues to buckle under never ending pressure, according to those on the frontline.

item.title: Andrew's arrest leaves questions for Sarah Ferguson but daughters could be protected
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest has cast another long shadow over the York family. While his ex-wife, Sarah Ferguson, has vanished from public view, their daughters Beatrice and Eugenie face an uncertain future.

item.title: School, university blindsided by child abuse allegations against teacher and academic Michael James Carty
item.description: A Victorian teacher and casual academic has resigned after being charged with possessing and distributing child abuse material.

item.title: Eight rescued from floodwater as severe weather warning continues for western Queensland
item.description: A tropical low is sitting over the south-eastern part of the Northern Territory, bringing the risk of heavy rainfall to parts of western Queensland that are already flooding.

item.title: South Africa defeats India in T20 World Cup Super Eight by 76 runs
item.description: South Africa bulldozed defending champions India by 76 runs in their Super Eight group one clash in the T20 World Cup, underlining their title credentials and sending a strong signal to their rivals.

item.title: Mum of missing Windale man fears son murdered after hospital discharge
item.description: The mother of a mentally ill man who went missing after he was discharged from hospital reveals she fears her son was murdered, having found a video on his phone showing a man threatening to kill him.

item.title: BAFTAs Film winners: Robert Aramayo wins best leading actor, Aussies miss out
item.description: British actor Robert Aramayo has beaten frontrunners Timothée Chalamet and Leonardo DiCaprio to take the leading actor BAFTA.

item.title: Mount Gambier man given three months to live documents battle with rare lymphoma
item.description: Mount Gambier man Ben Whitehead's world changed when he was diagnosed with lymphoma and initially given three months to live, but he's doing his best to stay positive.

item.title: Matildas Sam Kerr and Mary Fowler receive boost before Asian Cup
item.description: Australia's two superstar Matildas will fly home for the Women's Asian Cup in buoyant mood after Mary Fowler made her first start in 315 days and Sam Kerr proved once again she's the queen of the FA Cup with a smartly taken goal.

item.title: Opening of Midland Station marks end of Labor's flagship Metronet project
item.description: The completion of the new Midland train station brings an end to Labor's landmark Metronet project. At a cost of $15 billion, the project's final test now begins — whether West Australians believe it was money well spent.

item.title: Australia's golden 2026 Winter Olympic Games could just be the latest step towards sustained glory
item.description: Australia's medal-filled 2026 Winter Olympics campaign will live long in the memory. Not as the peak of this sunburned nation's snowy achievements, though. Just the beginning.

item.title: Disposable cameras in focus for Perth photography project
item.description: A unique community exhibition in Perth is celebrating the "messiness and spontaneity" of the disposable camera.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Eileen Gu reveals grief after gold medal, closing ceremony ends Games — quick hits from the final day
item.description: Chinese superstar Eileen Gu claimed gold while nursing the pain of loss, as Sweden's curling "circus" team triumphed. Here are the quick hits from the final day of the Milano Cortina Games.

item.title: Micro-abattoir gives Kimberley cattle producer 'alternative' when markets get tough
item.description: West Australian cattle producers are turning to on-farm abattoirs to secure their supply chain from paddock to plate.

item.title: 'Tough road ahead' for Burleigh Bears player Jacek McLaurin hospitalised by tackle
item.description: Burleigh Bears outside back Jacek McLaurin was rushed to Princess Alexandra Hospital in Brisbane on Saturday and remains in a critical condition.

item.title: Mexican army kills 'El Mencho', leader of powerful Jalisco New Generation cartel
item.description: Powerful Mexican drug lord Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, known as "El Mencho", is killed in a military raid, sparking a wave of unrest and violence in several Mexican states.

item.title: Reef researchers explore polyp prototypes to promote coral larvae settlement
item.description: Discovering what structure, material and colour is the most attractive for picky coral larvae could help bolster reef restoration and management efforts.

item.title: Cheryl Grimmer's family offered chance to reopen case after decades-long fight for justice
item.description: Cheryl Grimmer's family is offered the chance to have the case into the three-year-old's disappearance and death formally reviewed, 56 years after she vanished.

item.title: ACT Brumbies keeping cool after historic win over Crusaders in Christchurch
item.description: ACT Brumbies coach Stephen Larkham has said his team "won't get ahead of ourselves" after producing a stunning win over the Crusaders in Christchurch.

item.title: Younger people reflect on untapped 'wealth of knowledge' in intergenerational friendships
item.description: Headlines often highlight the divisions between older and younger Australians, but research suggests intergenerational friendships can help to reduce age-based discrimination in both directions, while offering other benefits.

item.title: How to maintain Antarctica's ice runway
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Denmark and Greenland reject Trump's offer to send naval hospital ship
item.description: Denmark and its territory Greenland reject Donald Trump's offer to send a naval hospital ship to the Arctic island coveted by the US leader.

item.title: Neighbouring farmers say overwhelming fire risk from Lake Magenta Nature Reserve in WA's south-east
item.description: WA farmer Doug Giles has warned that parts of Lake Magenta Nature Reserve haven't been burned in 25 years, raising fears of a dangerous fire.

item.title: What worked for Milano Cortina may not work for Brisbane 2032, but this is the new Olympic norm
item.description: The 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics Games was the first to follow a dispersed model. With Brisbane 2032 also set to have this set up, there are plenty of things to be aware of.

item.title: MAGA figure tells Australian conservatives Angela Merkel did more damage to Germany's fabric than Nazis
item.description: Benjamin Harnwell, the "international editor" of Steve Bannon's War Room podcast, says centre-right politicians have "betrayed" the West by supporting "mass immigration".

item.title: What experts want you to know about endometriosis, diagnosis and surgery as treatment
item.description: Allegations about endometriosis surgery have alarmed experts and distressed women living with the condition. Here's what to know about the chronic disease that affects about one in seven Australian women.

item.title: Portion of IS-linked Australians in Syria could resettle in NSW, premier says
item.description: Up to a third of Australian families of Islamic State fighters currently in a Syrian refugee camp could resettle in NSW if they eventually return to Australia, the state premier has said.

item.title: Ex-police officer Jonathan Andrew Beard cites 'cop's sixth sense' over allege knock and run assault
item.description: A former senior Sydney police officer accused of assaulting two men with a baseball bat who played a drunken game of knock and run at his house has told a court he "wasn't there to play" with home invaders.

item.title: Two men charged after man stabbed during confrontation in Kambalda
item.description: Two men are charged and another is flown to Perth with life-threatening stab wounds, after a weekend altercation in Kambalda.

item.title: Nine newspapers says printing The Age and The Australian Financial Review in Tasmania 'no longer sustainable'
item.description: Rising production costs and growing digital audiences are behind the company's decision to no longer print and distribute its newspapers, which includes The Age and The Financial Review, in Tasmania.

item.title: Cyber attack takes major chicken processor Hazeldenes offline leaving businesses without meat
item.description: A cyber attack at Hazeldenes chicken processing plant in central Victoria has stalled production and left butchers and pubs across the state without chicken.

item.title: Canberra man jailed for 20 years for fatally stabbing his ex-wife in 2023
item.description: A 73-year-old man who fatally stabbed his former partner in their kitchen in 2023 has been sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court.

item.title: Former UK PM Gordon Brown urges police to investigate if Andrew used RAF bases to meet Epstein
item.description: Former British prime minister Gordon Brown urges British police to investigate whether Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor used taxpayer-funded jets and Royal Air Force bases to meet with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: These four salads are tasty and substantial meals
item.description: If you’re after a healthy and summery dinner, these salads are a meal in a bowl and will tempt even the salad avoiders.

item.title: Richmond forward Mykelti Lefau suspended for two matches over drink driving charge
item.description: Mykelti Lefau is banned for two matches after a drink driving charge that will see him miss a pre-season clash as well as round one.

item.title: Killing of Mexico's biggest drug lord 'El Mencho' sparks chaos among cartel members
item.description: Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes died after a gunfight with military personnel. Hours later, vehicles were set alight, roads blocked and shopfronts torched as retaliation in eight states.

item.title: UK government quietly updates passport rules for dual citizens — again
item.description: Travellers with both an expired UK passport, issued in 1989 or later, as well as a valid passport from a country that can issue an Electronic Travel Authorisation, may now be allowed to enter the UK.

item.title: Monday Finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Toddler found unresponsive at Sydney day care may have died from a bacterial infection, inquest hears
item.description: A baby who died after being found unresponsive at a Sydney day care may have had a bacterial infection, an inquest has heard.

item.title: Tabatha Badger angling to replace outgoing Greens senator Peter Whish-Wilson
item.description: Tasmanian Greens MP Tabatha Badger is among the names vying to replace outgoing federal senator Peter Whish-Wilson.

item.title: The Lion King musical makes its return to Sydney
item.description: The Lion King musical makes its return to Sydney in April with the cast and crew opening its doors to rehearsals for a sneak peak.

item.title: Former youth worker Geoffrey Guest pleads not guilty to historical child sex abuse
item.description: Geoffrey John Guest is standing trial in Cairns after being charged with the abuse of a child in the 1970s.

item.title: Federal government commits further $229.6 million for Sydney to Newcastle high-speed rail
item.description: The federal government adds fresh funds to the hundreds of millions of dollars spent planning for a high-speed rail line between Sydney and Newcastle, pledging to have the project shovel-ready within two years.

item.title: Met Gala dress code announced as 'Fashion is Art' by New York's Museum of Metropolitan Art
item.description: The dress code for this year's Met Gala will be "Fashion is Art", the Metropolitan Museum of Art has announced.

item.title: Simon Burke on how 19 years of Play School fed into The Elocution of Benjamin Franklin
item.description: After five years starring in major musicals, Simon Burke returns to a much smaller stage in a one-man play, on its 50-year anniversary: The Elocution of Benjamin Franklin.

item.title: What is the difference between a homebirth and a freebirth?
item.description: Experts say creating awareness around how homebirthing and freebirthing differ is important in helping women make informed and safe decisions.

item.title: Peter Mandelson, former UK ambassador to US, released on bail as Epstein files fallout continues
item.description: Peter Mandelson, a political powerbroker and former government minister, has been investigated by London's Metropolitan Police for about three weeks over allegations of misconduct in public office.

item.title: Power supply for Macquarie Point stadium not yet costed or planned as key deadlines approach
item.description: Major upgrades to Hobart's power grid to supply the Macquarie Point stadium are yet to be finalised or costed, with the final estimate for the precinct's energy demand increasing by almost 50 per cent in a year.

item.title: Trump's dispute with Denmark over Greenland 'far from over', warns intelligence expert
item.description: A former chief analyst with the Danish Defence Intelligence Service warns diplomatic efforts to settle the Greenland dispute will fail.

item.title: Could Canada and Australia form a critical minerals supergroup?
item.description: Canberra's decision to sign a bilateral agreement with Canada to join forces on everything to do with critical minerals could prove to be a forerunner of things to come.

item.title: Australian exporters on notice as Trump tariff policy thrown into uncertainty
item.description: Business representatives have warned all Australian exporters they will need to monitor US trade policy carefully over coming weeks and months, as one firm owner estimates tariffs have cost him $1 million.

item.title: Regulator 'dropped the ball' by dismissing complaints about gynaecologist's practices, expert says
item.description: Australia's medical regulator, AHPRA, faces criticism for failing to act on complaints from patients about surgeries by Melbourne gynaecologist Simon Gordon.

item.title: Urgent care clinics ease emergency department demand but wait times unchanged
item.description: An independent review finds Labor's urgent care clinics face workforce shortages and problems with after-hours services, with no evidence hospital waiting times have improved.

item.title: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro speaks to ABC Sport's Amanda Shalala.
item.description: Sport news, live scores, features, analysis and photos from the world of sport. Comprehensive coverage of AFL, cricket, football, rugby league and rugby union. Audio interviews. News stories and highlights in video. Sports news bulletin.

item.title: Women's Asian Cup 2026: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro says 'we want to be a dominant force in Asia'
item.description: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro, who has had nine months in charge leading into the Women's Asian Cup starting this week, has bold ambitions for the tournament and the future of women's football.

item.title: Regional Victoria among the worst areas for meth use police say after Shepparton bust
item.description: Police say methylamphetamine trafficking is "insidious" in regional Victoria, with almost one trafficker a week charged over the past year.

item.title: Her son enlisted to fight for Ukraine. When his body was identified, it brought relief
item.description: Ruslana Bronovytska's son Dima did not tell her he was signing up to fight for Ukraine. When he went missing, it was the beginning of a new, hellish reality many people in the country face.

item.title: Solomon Islands denies China will run new police station in the heart of the capital Honiara
item.description: Authorities in Solomon Islands deny claims that Chinese police will run a new police post in Honiara's Chinatown district, but say Chinese police will instead "visit" the site.

item.title: Nathan Cleary's ban overturned as father acts as counsel at NRL judiciary
item.description: Ivan Cleary's legal prowess comes in handy as his son, Panthers star Nathan Cleary, sees his two-match suspension overturned at the NRL judiciary.

item.title: Crimes against humanity hearings against former Philippine leader Rodrigo Duterte open in The Hague
item.description: An International Criminal Court prosecutor tells judges that former Philippines president Rodrigo Duterte personally instructed members of a death squad to kill suspected criminals and drug users.

item.title: Inspection reveals substandard housing for PALM scheme workers in Gippsland
item.description: Migrant workers in Victoria's east were made to pay $190 a week to their employer for overcrowded, mouldy accommodation.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn narrowly dodged amputation after Winter Olympics crash left leg 'in pieces'
item.description: Lindsey Vonn credits her orthopaedic surgeon for being in Italy in the nick of time to save her left leg after her nightmare crash at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Economist warns rural NSW shires are on the verge of financial ruin
item.description: Huge areas, spiralling costs and a small revenue base do not add up for a growing number of councils in NSW.

item.title: ASX mostly flat amid tariff uncertainty on Wall Street — as it happened
item.description: With more tariff chaos from US President Donald Trump unsettling stocks globally, the ASX 200 was mostly flat on Tuesday. Look back on our blog from our ABC News business reporters.

item.title: William Barton on blending the ancient First Nations instrument, the yidaki, with classical music
item.description: Virtuoso William Barton, renowned for bringing together First Nations culture and European classical music, reflects on heritage and the lifelong pull of the yidaki.

item.title: Carney plans Australia trip to tighten trade and defence ties after warning of world order 'rupture'
item.description: The Canadian government confirms details of Prime Minister Mark Carney's trip to Australia, where he hopes to deepen ties on trade, defence and critical minerals as his country looks to reduce reliance on the US.

item.title: LGBTQIA+ community mourns death of Australian drag performer Maxi Shield
item.description: Maxi Shield was a veteran of the Australian drag scene and a regular performer at venues across Sydney's Oxford Street.

item.title: NFL players and coaches pay tribute to Rondale Moore after shock death of Vikings wide receiver
item.description: The NFL mourns after the shock death of Vikings wide receiver Rondale Moore.

item.title: Alcoa under investigation for alleged breaches of state mining agreement
item.description: Just days after being forced to pay $55 million for unlawfully clearing land in the world's only jarrah forest, it is revealed Alcoa is under investigation for alleged breaches of its agreement with the WA government.

item.title: BAFTA and BBC apologise for racial slur during awards show
item.description: Tourette syndrome advocate John Davidson, who shouted the slur, says it is not a reflection of his personal beliefs.

item.title: Homeless mother refused social housing after Centrelink payments deemed too high
item.description: Welfare payments are Rissa Blakeley's only source of income, but she and her kids have been left with no choice but to live in a park.

item.title: Shimron Hetmyer blasts West Indies to record T20 World Cup score in win over Zimbabwe
item.description: Shimron Hetmyer takes advantage of a dropped chance to blast his way to 85 as the West Indies maintain their unbeaten record at this year's T20 World Cup.

item.title: SA Liberal Party indicates One Nation preference as Alex Antic meets with Cory Bernardi
item.description: The South Australian Liberal Party has indicated it may direct preferences to One Nation ahead of Labor and the Greens. It comes as prominent Liberal senator Alex Antic was spotted having drinks with One Nation's lead SA candidate Cory Bernardi, amid speculation over a possible defection.

item.title: Victorian premier refers surgeon Simon Gordon allegations to police after Four Corners revelations
item.description: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has referred allegations against gynaecologist Simon Gordon to police, but the government will not conduct its own investigation.

item.title: Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao confirm rematch 11 years after 'Fight of the Century'
item.description: Manny Pacquiao has a chance to face Floyd Mayweather again as the American star comes out of retirement for a blockbuster rematch.

item.title: Sunshine Coast's iconic venue Solbar to close after more than 20 years
item.description: The Sunshine Coast's longest-running live music venue will close this weekend, after more than 20 years of hosting artists and performers.

item.title: Bunbury backpacker hostels ordered to close after asbestos, safety warnings ignored
item.description: Two backpacker hostels in Western Australia's largest regional city have been ordered to shut due to serious health and safety concerns, including asbestos exposure risks.

item.title: The 'first-night effect': Why it's hard to sleep when you're somewhere new
item.description: It's night-time and you're exhausted. But the hotel bed feels wrong. The mini fridge won't stop making that low, irritating hum. The power outlet lights feel brighter than the sun.

item.title: Farmers rally against 96 million litres per year Southern Downs water extraction and bottling facility
item.description: A developer has lodged an application with a rural Queensland council to build a water bottling, storage and export facility.

item.title: More than 70 dead after Mexico's biggest drug lord 'El Mencho' killed
item.description: At least 73 people have died in the attempt to capture cartel leader Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes and in the aftermath of his death.

item.title: Police suspect human remains to be abducted Sydney man
item.description: Eighty-five-year-old Chris Baghsarian was mistakenly snatched from his North Ryde property about 5am on February 13.

item.title: Opposition leader to boycott swearing-in of controversial new NT administrator David Connolly
item.description: Northern Territory Opposition Leader Selena Uibo says she will boycott the swearing-in of incoming administrator David Connolly, whose appointment has been embroiled in controversy due to a series of past social media posts.

item.title: Sam Walsh's eight-year contract extension the biggest deal in Carlton's history
item.description: Carlton locks down Sam Walsh to a massive eight-year contract extension as he turns down the lure of free agency.

item.title: Grace Tame abuser Nicolaas Bester unfit to stand trial over alleged 'menacing' social media posts
item.description: Nicolaas Ockert Bester has been deemed unfit to stand trial in the Hobart Magistrates Court over three counts of using a carriage service to menace, harass or cause offence.

item.title: Trump Tower developer Altus Property Group's David Young has twice gone bankrupt
item.description: A search by the ABC of federal insolvency records reveals the developer has had personal financial scrapes.

item.title: Australia confirms first full men's tour of South Africa since 2018 ball-tampering scandal
item.description: Steve Smith will be one of five Australian players from the infamous 2018 tour to return to South Africa later this year.

item.title: For some families, the social media ban has made things harder. Here's why
item.description: We spoke with three parents about how it has impacted their family and the different choices they are making around the ban.

item.title: Kash Patel and US men's hockey team under fire after Donald Trump makes joke about women's team
item.description: Viral video of Trump's White House invitation to the US men's hockey team sparks backlash online after the president jokes he would be 'impeached' if he did not also include the gold-medal winning women's team.

item.title: TasWater continues to push for higher water bills, despite regulator knock back
item.description: TasWater has continued to press its case for a steep water bill hike, despite the economic regulator's decision to halve its proposed price earlier this month.

item.title: Farmers are sick of being called 'resilient' and researchers say it's causing real harm
item.description: Farmers and mental health experts say it is time to stop calling farmers "resilient", with concerns it is making it harder for people to ask for, or be offered, help.

item.title: Blizzard hits US Northeast bringing cities to standstill, closing schools and disrupting flights
item.description: A record-breaking snowstorm pummels the north-eastern United States, bringing cities to a near-standstill for millions of residents.

item.title: WA Parliament to debate institutional child sex abuse laws in wake of 'retrograde' High Court decision
item.description: A tense political fight is brewing over the future of laws to compensate survivors of institutional child sexual abuse, as the government faces pressure to expand its scope beyond just churches and religious institutions.

item.title: Former Matildas label new Football Australia membership program a 'silencing mechanism'
item.description: A new membership program launched by Football Australia puts former Matildas players in a difficult position if they want to criticise the governing body.

item.title: Globetrotting ancient marine amphibians uncovered in lucky Kimberley fossil rediscovery
item.description: A salamander-crocodile type predator survived five extinction events and travelled from waters off Norway to WA's Kimberley coast.

item.title: Essential Caravans buys Zone RV, but customers left short-changed
item.description: A Melbourne-based company has purchased Zone RV, but customers who collectively paid millions before its collapse will be left out of pocket.

item.title: Former RBA governor Bernie Fraser calls for capital gains tax discount to be scrapped
item.description: Bernie Fraser tells a Senate committee hearing on capital gains tax that, if it were up to him, he would abolish the discount, as he warns younger Australians are watching the unaffordable housing market in "dismay".

item.title: Thousands without power as intense storms sweep across Melbourne
item.description: Storms are continuing to move across Victoria after dumping heavy rain across large parts of Melbourne today.

item.title: Woman allegedly attempts to snatch hijab from teenage girl in Brisbane
item.description: Queensland Police launch an investigation after a woman allegedly attempted to snatch a hijab from a teenage girl on the Brisbane bayside.

item.title: Could Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor be removed from the line of succession?
item.description: Is it possible to remove him? The short answer is yes — but it would most likely be a time-consuming process involving many parliaments passing legislation.

item.title: Bullet train surges through a station near the Tokyo CBD
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Australia has been waiting more than 40 years for a high-speed train
item.description: It has been more than 40 years since the idea of high-speed rail was first floated in Australia, but is it finally about to become a reality?

item.title: Rodney Wayne Williams fails appeal to overturn conviction for murdering pregnant teenager
item.description: Rodney Wayne Williams is serving life in jail for the murder of 16-year-old, pregnant Tiffany Taylor in Waterford West in July 2015.

item.title: AI body suddenly scrapped after 15 months spent finding experts
item.description: It took 15 months to narrow a field of 270 AI experts to 12 appointees for an AI authority, at a cost of almost $200,000, before it was suddenly scrapped by the federal government.

item.title: Gus Lamont's parents release public statement saying their lives have been 'shattered'
item.description: The parents of missing four-year-old Gus Lamont have released a public statement, saying "every moment without him is unbearable".

item.title: Gus Lamont's parents release new video
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Australia's women's team lose Ellyse Perry and Kim Garth to injuries for first ODI against India in Brisbane
item.description: Australia lose Ellyse Perry and Kim Garth for the ODI series against India, with Megan Schutt called up for the opening match where the visitors will bat.

item.title: Explosive detection dog Flo Joe posthumously awarded for military service in Afghanistan
item.description: In July 2007, explosive detection dog Flo Joe became the first Australian service dog to locate an improvised explosive device in Afghanistan. Today, she was posthumously recognised for her military service.

item.title: Popular WA outback tourist property Wooleen Station to be sold
item.description: A pastoral station in WA's Murchison region which has become a high-profile example of conservation is to be sold.

item.title: Half the country on flood watch as summer storms bring deluge of rain
item.description: There are widespread warnings for intense rain and potential flooding, as summer storms hit southern states and an unusually slow-moving system soaks central Australia.

item.title: Geoffrey John Guest to face fresh trial after Cairns District Court jury discharged
item.description: The judge decided a witness's "inadmissible" response under cross-examination in the trial of Geoffrey John Guest left her with no choice but to discharge the jury the day after it had been empanelled.

item.title: Australians will be among first to arrive in UK amid controversial new passport changes
item.description: Australians flying to the United Kingdom tonight will be among the first in the world to arrive under controversial new border rules.

item.title: WA government announces $140m plan to prevent repeat of record-breaking flu season
item.description: Creating more beds and boosting immunisation are key features of a $140 million "winter strategy" aimed at avoiding a repeat of WA's worst-ever flu season.

item.title: Fire ant authority considers penalties for business that spread nests to central Qld
item.description: The National Fire Ant Eradication Program is considering "enforcement actions" for a business accused of spreading nests to Queensland mine sites via a shipment of bricks.

item.title: Most flu deaths this century were recorded in 2025, ABS finds
item.description: There were more deaths associated with influenza last year than any other year this century, according to the Australia Bureau of Statistics.

item.title: New ACT firearms laws would allow police to search property of 'high-risk' individuals
item.description: The ACT government's plan to strengthen firearms laws could raise human rights issues by interfering with the right to privacy, a lawyer has warned.

item.title: Medicinal cannabis company offered 'kickbacks' to military advocates for veteran referrals
item.description: A representative for a telehealth company has been caught offering a military advocate a "kickback" for every veteran who signs up to an ongoing medicinal cannabis prescription.

item.title: Perth obstetrician Rhys Bellinge jailed over drunken high-speed crash that killed Elizabeth Pearce
item.description: A Perth obstetrician who killed a 24-year-old woman after smashing his high performance luxury car into the small hatchback she was a passenger in is sentenced to 10 years and six months in jail.

item.title: Banning transgender women from lesbian group could 'undermine their dignity', court hears
item.description: Transgender women will have their dignity "undermined" and could be made to feel "inferior" if a lesbian group is allowed to ban them from events, a court has heard.

item.title: Trans-Tasman Yacht Race from Sydney to Auckland postponed after withdrawal of most entries
item.description: The first running of the Trans-Tasman Yacht Race between Sydney and Auckland is called off days out from the start, after the withdrawal of the majority of entries.

item.title: France considering social media ban as devastated families launch legal action against TikTok
item.description: France is set to follow Australia with a social media ban but for these families, who are suing TikTok over what they say is a harmful algorithm, the battle is only beginning.

item.title: University of Notre Dame abruptly halts new enrolments in nursing course
item.description: Staff and prospective students say they have been left in the dark about why the university cancelled new nursing and midwifery students in the first semester of 2026.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: CDU's new London campus venture under fire amid accreditation scandal fallout
item.description: Charles Darwin University has been urged to focus on its "core business" amid questions about the financial viability of a new London campus it says will open up a new revenue stream.

item.title: Torres Strait Island men jailed over 110kg cocaine bust at top of Australian mainland
item.description: One of three men who used a dinghy to haul 110 kilograms of cocaine onto the Australian mainland has been jailed after telling a court he was helping a friend in exchange for a free boat trip.

item.title: Ash Barty to return to golf, as three-time tennis grand slam winner ready to play NZ Open pro-am
item.description: Ash Barty, Kelly Slater and Ricky Ponting are among the multi-talented sports stars in action in the pro-am component of the NZ Open.

item.title: Inquest into Aboriginal woman's death in custody hears of daughters' grief from losing 'loving mother'
item.description: Tammy Shipley died in a NSW prison cell in December 2022 after consuming excessive water, a complication of schizoaffective disorder known as polydipsia. Today her children told a coronial inquest that "if love could have saved her, she could have lived forever".

item.title: Man arrested on the Sunshine Coast over alleged sexual assaults
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Sunshine Coast man Riccardo Valenza charged with 31 offences, including 11 counts of rape
item.description: Sunshine Coast man Riccardo Valenza, 31, has been remanded in custody after police charged him with 31 offences relating to 11 alleged victims.

item.title: Gynaecologist referred to police after Four Corners report
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: WIN Network acquires Nine Darwin, expanding broadcast operations into the NT
item.description: Regional news broadcaster WIN has announced it will acquire Nine Darwin, just over a year after the Nine Network suddenly axed its Darwin TV news bulletin.
